headline: Cabbage Jambalaya
description: An easy recipe that will have the kids eating cabbage like it's going out of style! Ground beef and sausage are simmered together with tomatoes, onion, celery, cabbage and rice.
name: Cabbage Jambalaya
recipeIngredient: 1 pound smoked sausage, cut into 1/4-inch slices
1 pinch garlic salt, or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Combine ground beef, smoked sausage, onion, celery, and garlic in a large stock pot over medium-high heat. Cook and stir until beef is evenly browned, about 5 minutes. Stir in cabbage, tomatoes, water, and rice. Season with garlic salt.
Bring to a boil; reduce heat to low. Cover and cook, stirring once, until rice is tender, 35 to 40 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I found the recipe needed a bit more flavor, so I added crushed red pepper as well as salt and black pepper. That moved the recipe closer to a 4.4.
My whole family loves this dish! I use andouille sausage.
This is one of my favorites from Allrecipes. I'd eat it a couple times a month and be very happy!
Followed the recipe with one exception: I used beef broth in place of water as another reviewer suggested. Very good flavors!

This was amazing! I honestly didn't know if I'd like it, but wanted to try something new, something out of the norm, and this worked great. We added potato slices, pepper, and extra garlic with an extra half cup of water to help with the potatoes and it worked well. I think adding another can of tomatoes (with juice) may make up for that extra half cup of water. Twas great!

Did everything as stated, except used spicy Chorizo, tomatoes w/chilies and (low sodium) beef broth. Seasoned meat mixture with salt and pepper. Did not drain, as too much flavor would be lost. (Wasn't much fat any way) Stirred mixture before adding cabbage to pot. Brought liquid to boil, covered, and simmered for 20 minutes. Stirred, cabbage still raw. Cooked another 20 minutes, stirred, rice burned to pot, cabbage still too raw, although rice was done. Cooked another 10 or so. Cabbage now crisp tender. Removed from heat, stirred and tasted. Very bland, needs more spice. The recipe definitely needs work. I prefer not to cut cabbage smaller to get it done sooner. Not sure if I will try it again or not.
I didn’t make any changes and yes all make it again
I was skeptical but had to use up my cabbage. This is DELICIOUS! So glad I made this recipe. I’m going to make it often. Thank you for sharing it!

This had good flavor but like someone else said, it does NOT hold well as leftovers. Everything became a mess of rice and cabbage mush! I could barely get through the leftovers. Maybe if the rice is cooked separately and the soup is cooked less time, it might not get like that. So just be aware if you planned to eat this the day after.
We made this now twice, the first time had more cabbage, which I liked, but the other person in the house did not. Second time, made it with less cabbage, the other person liked it better.

This was better than I even anticipated. Hubby made it for us and it was yummy! He did add 1/2 c bell pepper and cooked it along with the meats. Also I didn't like the fact that it didn't give you any idea how much Cajun seasoning to add. We halved the recipe because there are only 2 of us. We used 1 tsp Cajun seasoning and tasted no heat. We like spicy dishes, so next time we will add 2 tsp. Great recipe , thank you!
I used 2-1/2 c of chicken broth, whole grain or brown rice...I put the rice under the cabbage..used a rotisserie Chicken instead of ground meat.
I used turkey hamburger and sausages. Used low sodium stew tomaotes (blended). Great taste. Will make it again. Froze the leftovers for another day.

I made this as stated, however I added Cajun seasoning. I also added chicken bouillon, tomato paste, 1cup water, kosher salt. Put it all in the pressure cooker for 30 mins. Delicious. May add peppers next time as we like a little spice.
We enjoyed this recipe. I made it as written except used beef broth instead of water and added cajun spice and other spices I typically use.
Easy and quick meal. Smells delicious, cant wait to eat it! We like spice so I added some red pepper flakes.
Very good. I threw in a couple tablespoons of fennel seeds with the cabbage.
Easy to make!
Wish I made a double batch. No leftovers from dinner.
I added Cajun seasoning and a small can of V8, delicious! Served over the rice with a splash of hot sauce. Family loved it, I will make this again!!
I did not think I would like the beef and sausage together, but somehow it worked! Excellent dish!

I was looking for something else to do with cabbage and found this wonderful recipe. It is very good and filling. It makes a lot so that you can feed a crowd. I actually only used 2 andouille sausages and it is just wonderful. Thank you Susan. This recipe is a keeper and I am sharing it with my sister and friends.

I loved this recipe but I did change it up a bit. I used 99 percent fat-free ground turkey and smoked turkey sausage. I browned the smoked turkey sausage in a separate skillet and reserved and added and the end of the cooking time due to the fact that turkey sausage cooked in a liquid get rather spongy also mixed in a tablespoon of Heinz chili sauce to the browned ground turkey and I also added a heaping teaspoon of Old Bay Seasoning . My wife loves this recipe
I made this recipe to take to a pot luck. It received several compliments , and 2 people requested the recipe. There were no leftovers to take home, and I will definitely make this dish again.
I give this a thumbs up. I also added some cajun seasoning about 1 ½ tea spoon. and left out the celery. made a huge pot so if it's just 1 person cut it in ½ or ¼
Not a cabbage fan, but LOVE this dish. Hardy, flavorful, great left overs!
This was so easy and so good!!! This is definitely a keeper!!!
Very tasty. My picky husband like it!

This came out so good! I did however alter the recipe a little bit by using chicken broth instead of water, added a chopped green bell pepper, ground turkey instead of beef, added cayenne pepper and Tony’s seasoning. I also skipped the rice (I’m just not a rice person) My boyfriend and co-workers loves it! Next time I’ll try this recipe and add okra.
It was on Point wow
This didn't really remind me of my Polish grandmother and her food I ate while growing up. I would have preferred just one meat and have it like the stuffed cabbage casserole instead.
Hi, I’m a yelp reviewer! Just kidding. This dish was pretty good! It was a little plain but I’m used to that. It’s a 4/5 stars. But this dish was super amazing. Good job!

This was not my favorite for a couple of reasons. It definitely did not call for enough liquid to adequately cook the rice (unless it was supposed to be minute rice - which was not indicated) I added one more can of tomatoes and a can of rotel as there was no spice at all. In addition I still needed a bit more water. The other issue I had was the lack of salt and pepper called for - I added quite a bit. At the end of the day this recipe was just ok and I would not likely make it again.
This servile is so yummy! The only addition I made was a tablespoon of this creole seasoning.
I used Tony's Chachere's seasoning
Nope.
I love this recipe! I used cans of Rotel and beef broth. Had kielbasa so I used that. Added a big squirt of siracha at the end. Delicious! Thanks for sharing this recipe!
Great stuff this is a soul food comfort food

This recipe is great comfort food and really flexible. I used beef broth in place of water and a box of Zatarains jambalaya rice for a fuller taste. It makes a TON (getting 4 freezer meals for 4 out of it). The second night we had the leftovers, I mixed in about 1/4 C of parmesan and layered mozzarella on top top to change the taste a bit. That was really delicious too! I served it with cornbread. Perfect meal.
It was great!!
Delicious! I used about 2 pounds ground beef added seasoning while browning it. Reminds me of the cabbage roll soup I made. Will definitely make again.
Very good. We really liked it. I added a few sprinkles of cayenne pepper, probably 1/8 tsp.
We made this recipe using chicken broth. It was a big hit. Will be adding this to our regular rotation of good meals.
Was delicious. Will be a versatile dish on my menu
I made it according to the recipe, and it had a nice flavor, but I think it could use a bit more spice
I did substitute the water for broth, and added red pepper for a little heat. It was excellent

This was great. I followed the directions, but made the following changes - I used two cups of beef broth instead of water, I added a can of Rotel (original with liquid), 3 cloves of shaved garlic, and only half a head of cabbage chopped.

Cooked on the stove and came out great. Everyone loved it and went back for more.
its just darn good

I put everything in the crock pot (no browning), and it was perfect for our taste. Very similar to a recipe I have for Unstuffed Cabbage Casserole but with the addition of the Kielbasa. I cooked it for about six hours on low.
It turned out great and I will be making it again.

I made this recipe as you see it, but opting for the broth rather than the water. If I were to make this recipe again, I would brown the gr. beef separately, fry some bacon and add some seasoning salt and more minced garlic to the drippings. Some crushed red pepper and or sugar if you would like. I would then proceed with the recipe and add the bacon bits from earlier for the last 5 minutes. Recipe a bit bland as it is, if revised I would give it a 5 star rating!

I made this recipe as you see it, but opting for the broth rather than the water. If I were to make this recipe again, I would brown the gr. beef separately, fry some bacon and add some seasoning salt and more minced garlic to the drippings. Some crushed red pepper and or sugar if you would like. I would then proceed with the recipe and add the bacon bits from earlier for the last 5 minutes. Recipe a bit bland as it is, if revised I would give it a 5 star rating!
This was a super easy recipe. My whole family loved it .
It was a little bland for my taste, but I will try it again with a spicy sausage and more salt!

Made it by the recipe, but added salt and used Conecuh sausage which had a little bit of kick to it. I shared this with a friend as well and her family loved it too. Thank you!
Joan Nummy

Home canned tomatoes in my cupboard for stewed tomatoes. Added a few drops of Ronnie's Revenge (Cajun green chili sauce, made in La. only available on Mackinaw Island, Mi!). My husband loved it and I like easy. Will make it again.
I would definitely make this again. It was really good. The only changes I made was I used diced tomatoes & extra cajun seasoning.

It was good, easy, but lacked something....I used Cajun seasoning to fill
That little flavor gap and, for me, it worked perfectly!!!
I followed the recipe exactly. The flavor was great, the only change I would make would be less rice. The rice overwhelmed the cabbage.
My husband and I loved it!!!

I only left out the shrimp, and it still was very tasty. I did add some hot sauce to taste after cooking. That made it more Cajun! Shrimp are just to expensive, and don't add much flavor. So I did not include them. As I live alone it was supper for several meals.
Easy and leftovers are even better.
Absolutely

Great and easy to make. I read most of the reviews bf I started so I decided to not use water but only beef broth. Added more beef broth so I could also add more rice. The finished pot tasted a little bland to me so I added a couple Table spoons of Italian Seasoning.
My family lived this dish. I made over the receipe easy and delicious.
Easy and good. However, I do not like spicy foods but this was bland to me. Perhaps I should have used Andouille sausage instead of the smoked.
It was beautiful. I've made it with chicken mince too with a bit of chilli. Very nice

(Previously reviewed, guess I have two accounts)

Somewhat bland but most likely due to my substitution of italian for smoked sausage. I was in a rush and should have looked a little harder. 

Either way this was a good wintertime meal and my wife and I both got lunch out of it as well, for less that $25! I would make it again, plus I've lined up another jambalaya recipe...
Easy to make. Tastes great and filling too.
I used boudin instead of sausage and rice and it gave it a nice kick!
Good recipe. I subbed chorizo for sausage and it cooked too hard. Will be better next time after this lesson.

A good wintertime meal but somewhat bland, probably because I substituted italian sausage for smoked sausage. I was in a rush and should have spent more time looking... 

Either way, I would make this again plus my wife and I both got a dinner and lunch from the recipe, for less than $25!
Winner, winner great one pan dinner! Excellent recipe Susan. We like heat in this type of dish so I added spices to kick it up! Love it! Will make it again and again!!
I made this recipe exactly as described, using ground beef and turkey wieners. My husband and I both loved it. There was very little left over. We will definitely make it again.

I made this, didn't put as much cabbage as recipe called for cause I only had 1/2 head of cabbage, but I'm glad I didn't put in a whole head. Also didn't have stewed tomatoes so I used a can of diced tomatoes instead. Overall the dish came out excellent and will definitely make it again!
Tasted fine. Had to half the recipe. Too much for two people. Used the whole can of tomatoes
This was great. Although I added an extra can of chopped tomatoes and doubled the meat. I would definitely make this again. My family went nuts
Fast and easy recipe that the family enjoyed. Grandson liked it so much, and we had much, ate it three days in a row.
I made a couple changes because I didn't want to go to the store. It turned out great!
This was SO tasty. Will definitely make it again. Next time I will double the sausage (I used kielbasa) and used riced cauliflower since we don't eat rice. Will also throw in some red peppers yum!!
This was excellent! When I told my husband what was for dinner, he wrinkled his nose. The first bite said it all and after two bowls said, "That's a keeper!"

I made this tonight for the first time and it was easy and delicious! I only made a couple of changes by adding a large carrot chopped, (2) 13 oz lite kielbasa, because we like extra, 3 1/2 stalks of celery, a can of low sodium chicken broth in place of the water, some everything bagel seasoning and some ground pepper. The whole family loved it. It's easy to make variations to your liking with this recipe. I will definitely keep this in our dinner rotation. Yummy!!!
This was at least a 4.5! I used s
Because my family likes things a little spicier, I added a can of Rotel Tomatoes with Green Chiles. We also added some shredded raw cabbage on top and it was a hit! Great one-pot meal!
We love this I use chicken broth instead of water and Garlicpepper and a little basil too it too what ever you like
Added carrots really good. Will make this again

After reading reviews of this recipe, I also used beef stock in lieu of water, Cajun seasoning, red onion and pepper jack cheese stuffed sausage. I’m impressed with how tasty and easy this meal was. I’m definitely going to cook this again!

I made this recipe using a couple of the suggestions here like, I used broth and I also used Old Bay Seasoning which made it more spicy. Our family loved it and I will be making it again. It was very easy and only used 1 pot.
this is a great recipe. I had it a tablespoon of Kingsford cajun spice. It did not make it spicy but it added a little extra flavor.

We liked it. I made a few modifications as suggested in the reviews. I used turkey hamburger and I didn't have any rice so we used orzo on hand. Used creole seasoning and some cayenne pepper. I used tomato sauce in addition to tomatoes and water. We will make this again.

Definitely will
Make again. I used chicken breast became I had no beef. Used more salt a garlic because I like mores season. Needed to add more water. 
Delicious! Next time will do with beef.
Yes no meat and I use vegetable broth
Love it
I deffently will be fixing this recepe offton.
Just saw this recipe. I have everything but the celery. Using a can of beef broth, instead of water. I think it's going to be great (with a pan of cornbread).
Loved it

If you are doing a KETO based diet you can really lessen the carbs by using riced cauliflower.It comes frozen in a bag so you would use much less water and shorter cooking time by cooking rice in micro wave per instructions and adding it to meat/veggie mixture.I did this , mixed it all together and baked it for 20 mins.Delicious !

Only used 1/2 lb hamburger, added a few shakes of Old Bay Seasoning, subbed 1 can beef broth for water, and used Uncle Ben's long grain white rice. Followed directions. It was SO good! Ate with Krusteaz Southern Cornbread Mix. We liked it a lot and it's very easy!

I'll definitely make it again! Everybody loved it! I used diced tomatoes instead of stewed, and added a tiny bit of cajun seasoning(didn't need much!). Super easy, I think this might be really good with some cheese melted over it too!
